page.title: 02GREAT BUDBRIDGE MANOR
page.content: FARMING_GREAT BUDBRIDGE MANOR. Great Budbridge Manor is situated in the north west corner of our area. Built mainly of stone, with some brick, it is largely 17th century, though may have earlier origins, as is evidenced by a low arched door on the west facing side.The frontage is that of a typical small manor house, double fronted with a porch with rooms above. The upper windows are mullioned.The lower windows have been replaced and the mullions removed, possibly earlier this century.Like the owners of many of the manors on the island, those of Great Budbridge have turned the land to commercial use. In this case, 3 acres of commercial greenhouses have been erected, in which 30,000 tomato plants are grown annually.The tomatoes are sent to all parts of Gt.Britain. )
